title: reichert - serif font
content:
I’m not finding this in my collection and whatthefont came up with nothing. Any ideas?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007003445im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/reichert_3598.jpg)

 [‹ Lettering samples from the late 1800s](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007003445/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35420 "Go to previous forum topic") [BEST THING GEORGE W. BUSH EVER MADE! ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007003445/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35414 "Go to next forum topic")
author: vector

comments.content:
I think this may be [Calisto](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007003445/http:/www.philsfonts.com/detail.html?sku=AG71110403P2), by Ron Carpenter.

- Mike Yanega
Calisto [squooshed](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007003445/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/squooshed) with added contrast … there isn’t a Calisto Display, is there?

Knowing how easy it is to ’tweak’ fonts using Illustrator, for example, makes me just try to look for the shapes, or ’bones’, of the letterforms. I think Calisto only has four weights and two of them are Italics.

- Mike Yanega
